title: fluxnet
text: paths downloading FLUXNET data. just want download everything available, simply run flux_download(). can download just specific sites site_ids argument, can filter results flux_listall() pass .
code: # Download everything available. flux_download()  # Download just certain sites flux_download(site_ids = c("AR-CCg", "AR-TF1", "BR-CST"))  # Filter list and download list_wet <- list[list$igbp == "WET",] flux_download(file_list_df = list_wet)

title: fluxnet
text: flux_extract() allows unzip desired files downloaded site .zip files.
code: # Extract everything (not recommended!) flux_extract()  # Extract just annual and monthly data flux_extract(resolutions = c("y", "m"))  # Extract hourly data for just certain sites flux_extract(site_ids = c("AR-CCg", "AR-TF1"), resolutions = "h")  # Don't extract BIF and BIFVARINFO CSVs flux_extract(extract_varinfo = FALSE)

title: fluxnet
text: can read data passing manifest flux_read(). can read data just select sites site_ids argument, complex filtering can simply subset manifest object first.
code: # Read all available annual data annual <- flux_read(manifest, resolution = "y")  # Read in hourly data from specific sites hourly <- flux_read(   manifest,   resolution = "h",   site_ids = c("AR-CCg", "AR-TF1") )  # Read in only ERA5 data annual_era5 <- flux_read(manifest, resolution = "y", datasets = "ERA5")  # Filter manifest to just sites with "WET" for IGBP n_wet_manifest <-    left_join(manifest, list, by = join_by(site_id)) %>%   filter(igbp == "WET", location_lat > 0)  n_wet_monthly <- flux_read(n_wet_manifest, resolution = "m")

code: flux_download(   file_list_df = NULL,   site_ids = "all",   download_dir = "fluxnet",   overwrite = FALSE,   use_cache = TRUE,   cache_dir = rappdirs::user_cache_dir("fluxnet"),   cache_age = as.difftime(30, units = "days"),   log_file = NULL,   echo_cmd = FALSE )

title: Download FLUXNET zip files — flux_download
text: file_list_df NULL (default), flux_listall() used determine sites data available download (specific sites can selected site_ids).  file_list_df supplied, data frame generated flux_listall(), potentially filtered exlude rows. provides alternative way downloading specific sites. See examples possible use case. file_list_df NULL, cache_dir, use_cache, cache_age ingored site_ids "" still used. site_ids Character; either "" download sites available, vector site IDs. example, c("UK-GaB", "CA-Ca2"). download_dir directory download zip files . overwrite Logical; overwrite already downloaded .zip files? FALSE skip downloading existing files, unless invalid .zip files (e.g. due partial download corruption). use_cache Logical; use cached list files available download exists older cache_age? cache_dir directory store list available FLUXNET data . cache_age difftime object length 1. cached snapshots recent cache_age, new one downloaded stored. can force cache invalidated cache_age = -Inf. log_file optional file path (e.g. "log.txt") direct fluxnet-shuttle log . Useful debugging. echo_cmd Set TRUE print shell command console. Passed processx::run().

title: Download FLUXNET zip files — flux_download
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Download data for all available sites flux_download()  # Download data for just select site IDs flux_download(site_ids = c("UK-GaB", "CA-Ca2"))  # Download specific sites filtered by site metadata (IGPB  and data hub for example) available_sites <- flux_listall() to_get <-   available_sites[available_sites$igbp == "CRO" & available_sites$data_hub == "AmeriFlux", ] flux_download(file_list_df = to_get)  # Get a fresh list of available data and overwrite any existing downloads flux_download(use_cache = FALSE, overwrite = FALSE) } # }

title: Extract FLUXNET data from downloaded zip files — flux_extract
text: zip_dir directory zip files output_dir directory unzip files .  Within directory, data files nested site. site_ids character vector site IDs (e.g. c("AR-TF2", "CA-Ca2")) can supplied unzip data certain sites.  "" (default), zip files found zip_dir unzipped. resolutions character vector indicating time resolutions extract.  Options yearly ("y"), monthly ("m"), daily ("d"), hourly/half-hourly ("h"). Multiple options may passed default. extract_varinfo Logical; extract BIF BIFVARINFO files containing variable information BADM Interchange Format? Defaults TRUE. extract_txt Logical; extract README.txt DATA_POLICY_LICENSE_AND_INSTRUCTIONS.txt files? Defaults FALSE. overwrite Logical; existing extracted files overwritten (TRUE) ignored (FALSE)?
